channel.title: UMDCTF on Tchoupapps-fr
channel.description: Recent content in UMDCTF on Tchoupapps-fr

item.title: PHILLIP2
item.description: Phillip 2 Description We have 3 files in this challenge: module.dwarf philip-2.raw.zip System.map-5.8.0-25-generic The module.dwarf and System.map are the same than phillip 1, so I re-use the profile. Solve Fristly, we are checking the bash history: $ sudo vol.py -f philip-2.raw --profile=Linux_phillipx64 linux_bash NOTHING_FOUND Ok, lets try to found and dump .bash_history: $ sudo vol.py -f philip-2.raw --profile=Linux_phillipx64 linux_enumerate_files | grep /home/lubuntu/.bash_history Volatility Foundation Volatility Framework 2.6.1 0xffff95f1c623fc30 5690 /cow/upper/home/lubuntu/.

item.title: PHILLIP1
item.description: Phillip 1 Description We have 3 files in this challenge: module.dwarf philip-1.raw.zip System.map-5.8.0-25-generic Solve We quickly understand, we have dwarf and System.map for built a custom volatility profile, for analysing our philip-1.raw . So let’s build it: $ zip _phillip.zip module.dwarf System.map-5.8.0-25-generic $ sudo mv _phillip.zip /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/volatility/plugins/overlays/linux/. $ sudo vol.py --info | grep phillip Volatility Foundation Volatility Framework 2.6.1 Linux_phillipx64 - A Profile for Linux _phillip x64 Ok,now we have the profile, we can dig into our dump.
